article.headline: LIU 75, Bryant 70
article.story: NEW YORK -- Jason Brickman scored 15 points to lead all of LIU-Brooklyn's starters in double figures, and the Blackbirds defeated Bryant 75-70 Thursday night. C.J. Garner and Julian Boyd scored 12 points each, Jamal Olasewere 11 and Michael Culp 10 for LIU (16-7, 10-1 Northeast Conference). The Blackbirds shot 40 percent from 3-point range (6 of 15), including 4 of 4 from Brandon Thompson in their fifth straight win. The Bulldogs (2-21, 1-10) made 2 of 18 from behind the arc. LIU trailed 29-27 with 8:33 left in the first half before going on a 9-4 run. Olasewere's free throw gave the Blackbirds a 36-33 lead with 3:27 left until halftime, and it would remain close. Bryant pulled within 72-70 with 11 seconds left but LIU went 3 of 4 from the line to seal it. Alex Francis had 20 points and 11 rebounds for the Bulldogs, who lost their eighth straight.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
